Choosing Copiers for Different Event Sizes

June 24, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Choosing Copiers for Different Event Sizes: A Comprehensive Guide

When planning events, one key aspect that organizers must consider is the copier rental for attendees. Whether you’re hosting a small meeting, a large conference, or an exhibition, the type of copier you choose will greatly impact the smooth running of your event. In this guide, we’ll walk you through everything you need to know about choosing copiers for different event sizes, ensuring you meet the demands of your attendees while staying within budget.

Why Copier Choice Matters for Events

Copiers are more than just office equipment; they are essential for keeping everything running efficiently during events. From printing handouts to making last-minute changes to event schedules, the right copier ensures that guests, exhibitors, and speakers can access printed materials when they need them. But not all events require the same type of copier. The size and scope of your event will determine what kind of copier will serve you best.

Event Sizes and Their Copier Needs

1. Small Events (10-50 People)

Small events are typically intimate gatherings such as business meetings, workshops, or small conferences. For these events, you don’t need a large-scale copier with high output capacity. A compact, easy-to-use copier will be sufficient to handle the basic printing, scanning, and copying needs.

Key Considerations:

  • Speed and Efficiency: You won’t need a copier with extreme speed, but efficiency is important for handling light printing tasks in a short amount of time.

  • Functionality: A multi-functional copier is a good choice, offering printing, copying, and scanning capabilities to keep things versatile.

Recommended Copier:

  • Compact desktop or mid-range copiers

  • 20-30 pages per minute (PPM) printing speed

  • Small footprint to save on space

For a more detailed look at copier placement in small event settings, check out this guide on copier placement strategies for events.

2. Medium-Sized Events (50-200 People)

Medium-sized events, such as local conferences, seminars, or training sessions, demand more from a copier in terms of volume. During these events, you may have higher printing demands, with multiple participants needing access to print materials.

Key Considerations:

  • Output Capacity: A copier with a higher page-per-minute rate is necessary. Opt for machines that can print up to 50 PPM.

  • Reliability: Since these events will likely last longer, a copier that can handle continuous use without frequent jams or slowdowns is essential.

  • Networking Capability: Look for copiers that can be connected to a network, so multiple users can access it from various locations.

Recommended Copier:

  • Larger floor-standing copiers

  • 40-50 PPM printing speed

  • Connectivity features for networking multiple devices

To ensure your copier fits seamlessly into your event setup, learn more about copier setup and logistics.

3. Large Events (200+ People)

Large events, such as conventions, exhibitions, or trade shows, require high-performance copiers that can handle a significant volume of printouts in a short time. These events may involve hundreds of attendees, exhibitors, and speakers who all need easy access to print services.

Key Considerations:

  • High Capacity: A copier with a high-volume print capacity is essential. You’ll need copiers with high output speeds (60 PPM or more).

  • Multiple Units: In many cases, multiple copiers will be needed to handle different areas of the event, such as break-out sessions, registration desks, and exhibitor booths.

  • Security Features: For events where sensitive information is being printed, choose copiers with advanced security features like secure printing.

Recommended Copier:

  • High-speed copiers with 60+ PPM

  • Additional features like duplex printing, large paper trays, and secure print capabilities

  • Multiple copiers stationed in various locations to meet attendee demands

To understand the best copier options for large-scale events, consider reading our guide on speed and efficiency in event copiers.

Key Features to Look for in Event Copiers

Regardless of the event size, certain features should always be considered when choosing copiers for events.

  • Speed: The faster the copier, the better it can handle high traffic. For larger events, look for a copier that prints at least 40 PPM.

  • Volume Capacity: Always match the copier’s capacity with the expected print volume. Make sure that the copier can handle the expected number of pages per hour.

  • Multi-functionality: Having a copier that also scans and faxes can be a bonus for events with diverse printing needs.

  • Security: Sensitive documents should be kept secure with features like PIN-code printing or encrypted connections.

  • Ease of Use: The copier should be simple for anyone to use, especially in event settings where attendees may not be familiar with the equipment.

Where to Place Your Copier for Maximum Efficiency

In event spaces, copier placement is crucial for maximizing efficiency and ensuring accessibility. For small events, a single, centralized copier may be sufficient. For larger events, you may need multiple copiers placed strategically around the venue.

  • High-Traffic Areas: Place copiers in areas with heavy foot traffic, such as near registration desks or in common areas.

  • Near Session Rooms: For larger events, have a copier in or near each session room to handle printing requests from speakers and attendees.

  • Quiet Zones: In exhibitions, place copiers in quieter areas where attendees can take a break from the hustle and bustle.

You can learn more about copier placement strategies for large events in our article on copier placement strategies.

Final Thoughts

Choosing the right copier for your event is critical to ensuring a smooth and successful experience for both attendees and organizers. Whether you’re hosting a small meeting, a medium-sized conference, or a large exhibition, understanding your event's copier needs is the first step toward making the right choice.

By considering factors such as event size, printing volume, and the necessary features, you can select a copier that fits your event perfectly. Don’t forget to think about logistics, placement, and speed to guarantee that your guests have the resources they need to stay on top of their tasks.

For additional tips on copier rentals for events, check out this page on choosing copiers for different event sizes.
